PageTitle: maximum load-balancing (BGP multi-instance VPN instance IPv4 address family view)
FuncDef:
The maximum load-balancing command sets the maximum number of equal-cost routes for load balancing.
The undo maximum load-balancing command restores the default setting. The maximum load-balancing command sets the maximum number of equal-cost routes for load balancing. The undo maximum load-balancing command restores the default setting. By default, the maximum number of equal-cost routes for load balancing is 1, and load balancing is not implemented.
ParentView: BGP multi-instance VPN instance IPv4 address family view

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the maximum number of equal-cost routes for load balancing.
The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 128.

Specifies the maximum number of equal-cost EBGP routes for load balancing.
The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 128.

Specifies the maximum number of equal-cost IBGP routes for load balancing.
The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 128.

Configures a BGP device to change the next hop addresses of routes for load balancing to its address only when the device advertises these routes.
-

ExtraInfo:
After this command is run, multiple BGP equal-cost routes will implement load balancing, improving network resource efficiency.
